title: Evolution of Healthcare Subcultures and Dual-Learning Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic healthcare system structures, organizational culture, and foundational medical knowledge
context.additional_context: Focuses on cultivating the ability to systematically analyze subculture change processes within organizations and apply deutero-learning theory to real cases for medical professionals. Features asynchronous collaboration and discussion activities in a smartphone-based LMS environment.

learning_goals: Learners can classify evolutionary stages of subcultures in healthcare organizations and explain key factors at each stage.
Applying a dual-learning model, learners can diagnose pathological/positive learning patterns and propose improvement strategies.
Learners can apply dual governance principles (expert management vs. service principles) to real-world cases in healthcare subculture management.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
